clinical_study.brief_title: Aftercare for Adolescents Treated for Alcohol Abuse and Dependence
clinical_study.official_title: Maintenance of Treatment Gains in Adolescents With Alcohol Related Disorders

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)

clinical_study.source: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)

brief_summary.textblock: The study examines the relative efficacy of two active aftercare interventions (i.e., face-to-face , brief phone) with no-active aftercare for adolescents who completed outpatient treatment for alcohol use disorders(AUD)

detailed_description.textblock: In this study 177 adolescents meeting criteria for alcohol use disorders (AUD) received weekly cognitive-behavioral therapy group sessions. 144 completers were randomized into the 3 individual aftercare (AR) conditions noted above. Manualized active interventions were composed of 5 sessions of integrated motivational enhancement and cognitive behavioral therapies. Outcomes assessments were done at end of aftercare, 3-6-and 12 months post AC completion.

primary_outcome.measure: Alcohol use (days of use and days of heavy drinking)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3, 6, and 12 months post aftercare condition completion

secondary_outcome.measure: Drug use according to primary outcome timeframe

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adolescents between the ages of 13-18 years
- Meeting criteria for DSM-IV alcohol use disorders
- Able to comprehend and read English at the 5th grade level
- Participant and family member are willing to provide a locator information.
- Not planning to move out of state during the next 12 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Meet any substance dependence criteria other than nicotine or cannabis
- Meet life time diagnosis of schizophrenia
- Reported a suicidal ideation with a plan, suicidal attempt, or self-injurious behavior in the last 30 days
- Having a medical condition that may prevent them from consistently attending and constructively participating in treatment and aftercare
